metadata.title: Block IP - Azure Firewall IP groups
metadata.description: This playbook allows blocking/allowing IPs in Azure Firewall. It allows to make changes on IP groups, which are attached to rules, instead of make direct changes on Azure Firewall. It also allows using the same IP group for multiple firewalls. [Learn more about IP Groups in Azure Firewall](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/firewall/ip-groups)
mainSteps:: When a new Sentinel incident is created:

1. An adaptive card is sent to the SOC channel providing IP address, Virus Total report, showing list of existing firewalls in the Resource group and providing an option to add IP Address to IPGroups or Ignore.

2. If SOC user confirms yes, the IP Address gets added to IPGroups under IPAddress section and incident will get updates with endpoint information, summary of the action taken and virus total scan report.
3. Else, incident will get updates with endpoint information and summary of the action taken.
prerequisites: 1. Create IP Groups and attach them to Azure Firewall rules.

2. Create a Service Principal which the Azure Firewall connector will use, and grant Contributor permissions to it on the IP groups. ['Detailed instructions'](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Playbooks/AzureFirewall/AzureFirewallConnector#azure-active-directory-service-principal)
3. Deploy Azure Firewall Logic Apps custom connector under the same resource group (see link below). **Permissions required for this playbook** This playbook **Gets** and **Updates** IP groups.

4. To use VirusTotal connector in this playbook, get your [Virus Total API key](https://developers.virustotal.com/v3.0/reference#getting-started). Otherwise, erase these steps or replace them with other TI sources.

metadata.description: Name of the Logic Apps resource to be created
Name of the custom connector which interacts with Azure Firewall. Cannot contain spaces.

clientSecret.defaultValue: <enter the Client secret of the application>

body.message:
Azure Firewall Playbook performed the following action:

IP Address :  @{items('For_each_Malicious_IP_Address_Entity_present_in_the_Incident')?['Address']}

Got Virus Total Report  :

Country  :  @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['country']}
Continent : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['continent']}
ASN : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['asn']}
AS_Owner L : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['as_owner']}

Total Votes :
 
 Malicious : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['malicious']}
 Positives Votes : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['harmless']}
 Negative Votes :  @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['malicious']}
 Suspicious Votes: @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['last_analysis_stats']?['suspicious']}
 Number of reports saying that is Undetected : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['last_analysis_stats']?['undetected']}
Network : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['network']}

Action Taken in Azure Firewall

Added IP Address :  @{items('For_each_Malicious_IP_Address_Entity_present_in_the_Incident')?['Address']} to the IPGroup

Add_comment_to_incident_with_the_Virus_T.description: Add a comment to the incident with the Virus Total report and the action taken

Append_malicious_IP_Address_to_the_exist.description: Append the Malicious IP Address to the variable IPAddresses

Assign_Existing_IP_Addresses.description: Variable to store the Existing IP Addresses

Creates_or_updates_an_ipGroups_in_a_spec.description: Post the list of IP Addresses along with Malicious IP Address present in the Incident

Gets_the_specified_ipGroups.description: Get all the IP Addresses present in the provided Resource group from Azure Firewall connector

Condition_to_check_malicious_IP_Address_.description: Condition to compare with the Action chosen to Block the IP Address or Ignore

Gets_all_IpGroups_in_a_resource_group.description: Lists all the IP Groups present in the Resource Group

Ip_scan_report_V3.description: Reports the input IP Address is Malicious

Select_IPGroups_Choice_List_to_show_in_t.description: Prepare IP Groups Choice list to show in the Adaptive Card

List_-_IP_Groups_present_with_in_the_Res.description: Variable to assign IP Groups present with in the Resource Group
